qas.question: The Slavs make their first appearance in Byzantine records when?
The Slavs were under what name in the early 6th century?
According to Byzantine historiographers, tribes of Slavs emerged from what areas?

answers.text: the Carpathian Mountains, the lower Danube and the Black Sea

qas.question: Tribes of Slavs were invading what provinces of the Eastern Empire?
Under whose reign did Byzantine historiographers describe Slavic tribes?
When did Procopius of Caesarea live?
What was another name for Byzantine?
What mountains did the Byzantine people come from?

context: The Slavs under name of <a1_0>the <b8_0>Antes and the Sclaveni<b8_0/><a1_0/> make their first appearance in Byzantine records <a0_0>in the <b5_0>early 6th century<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Byzantine historiographers <a4_0>under Justinian I<a4_0/> (<b6_0>527–565<b6_0/>), such as Procopius of <b7_0>Caesarea<b7_0/>, Jordanes and Theophylact Simocatta describe tribes of these names emerging from the area of <a2_0>the <b9_0>Carpathian<b9_0/> Mountains, the lower Danube and the Black Sea<a2_0/>, invading <a3_0>the Danubian provinces<a3_0/> of the Eastern Empire.
